channel.title: Pacman 2d
channel.description:
im obsessed with pacman, so i decided to make my own pac game. this isnt original pacman, its kind of like a mix between two different games, right now i have made 5 levels as a beta just to get comfortable, and i havnt added graphics to the level object like ladders, platforms, and pacdots, but this is the basic look ad feel so far.
[IMG]http://i56.tinypic.com/2zsuzxt.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i52.tinypic.com/14ig30x.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i56.tinypic.com/1z3xzif.png[/img]
this game is goes by left walk, right walk, and height. it has gravity so you can fall to other platforms if you wish.
right now, the ghosts only walk back and forth, changing direction by either touching the wall, or a random direction change, dots are eatable, big dots make ghost eatable, cherry sends you to the next level. i figured, like pacman, the level objects and paths only change about, every 5 or 10 levels, along with the level coloring after a cut screen. so, i will make my game probably the same way, im not sure if i will add cut screens, but it wouldn't be hard to do anyways.
ill add more pictures, and when i finish all 255 levels, IF i finish all of them, i will release source.
note: this is the SECOND game i have made from complete scratch, most of you would probably say the coding is shit, but im working on it. :)
demo download, first 20 levels: [URL=http://uppit.com/3cbdl18akvkq/pacman_2d.rar]pacman 2d.rar - 35 Kb[/URL]

item.title: Pacman 2d
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:20, topic:358400”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=454906.msg3335949#msg3335949 date=1283901996]

[quote author=hat trix link=topic=454906.msg3335936#msg3335936 date=1283901502]
thanks ollie, i thought the same ;). im going to look into adding platforms,ladders, ect. through data files and such.
[/quote]you might want to consider the game competition (thread on this forum), clearly you have an affinity for writing games, so it should suit you just fine

By the way, i would suggest using spritesheets instead of individual images for each frame as well as image transformations. You only need 1 ghost sprite for one direction, then you can just mirror the image in java using code, and you can store multiple sprites in one image and just call getSubimage(x, y, width, height) to get just a portion of the image.
[/quote]If you don’t cache the sub-images, it ends up becoming very slow.[/quote]that’s what you have a spritesheet class for!

Read full topic

By the way, i would suggest using spritesheets instead of individual images for each frame as well as image transformations. You only need 1 ghost sprite for one direction, then you can just mirror the image in java using code, and you can store multiple sprites in one image and just call getSubimage(x, y, width, height) to get just a portion of the image.[/quote]If you don’t cache the sub-images, it ends up becoming very slow.

You only need 1 ghost sprite for one direction, then you can just mirror the image in java using code, and you can store multiple sprites in one image and just call getSubimage(x, y, width, height) to get just a portion of the image.

item.title: Pacman 2d
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

The game is fun, but the code is horrible. As super_ said, try to abstract levels/worlds. Defining levels through a configuration system would be best.

I see a tremendous amount of hard-coding. You should always try to make an application as dynamic and as easy to develop as possible. All of the resource-loading, drawing, event handling, and basically the rest of the engine processing is hard-coded. Try to buy a book on game developing, or on general application design. It should help.

Also, swing provides double buffering support by default. This option can be toggled via the ‘JComponent.setDoubleBuffered(boolean)’ function. So no need for your custom back buffering method. Also, painting on top of a JFrame is a horrible idea. Instead, paint on a swing container such as a JPanel.

You should also look into archiving all of your external resources (sprites, etc) into the same JAR used as a codebase since this provides ease of usability. Look here for more info.

But overall good job, especially as it is your first game. I remember my first game was equitable, if not worst, to how yours is written. You will progressively improve, though.

If I have time, I’ll write my own version of pacman along with a simple level editor so you can learn from it.

Read full topic

item.title: Pacman 2d
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“hat trix, post:12, topic:358400”]thanks, thats actually a complement.

and what do you mean by abstract worlds. :D[/quote]You only need one class to represent World, then you can just store individual maps or “levels” in some data format.

Read full topic
